Wolfblade:

She was pleasently shocked when he kissed her back so swiftly. She
really wanted to have more time with him, but she tld herself that the
Matrix just had it in for her.  Her scanners showed a signal that came
in close and then trailed off. "Hmm, could be trouble."  Her optics
flashed red then back to normal. "Ohhh, I hope it is. I am in the mood
for kicking some slag. Or something else."  She gave him a teasing
look. Her honor programs told her she was in the mood for an oil
change more than anything. Then turned and faced the direction of the
signal. "Let's proceed with caution."  She tranformed into wolf mode
and started running towards the signal. Who needs caution anyway, she
told herself. 



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> wrote:
> Malice::
>  
> Malice checked Wolfblade's reading with his own sensor array,
confirming the signal.  He was about to make another wise crack when
she leaned up and kissed him a second time.  He paused mid stride to
kiss her back, and had to break the tender moment as his sensors
picked up movement close by.  He looked in the direction the signal
came from, trying to pin down signal's sourse.
>  
> "Something or someone is out there, watching us," he said softly,
not wanting to let this observer get away unpunished should the need
arise.
>
